column1: Topic title: 世界銀行不但認同大馬實行 GST，更建議解除一些免 GST 物品來擴大政府收入

column3: text
世界銀行不但認同大馬實行 GST，更建議解除一些免 GST 物品來擴大政府收入。世界銀行不懂吃了多少 dedak，竟然護航 GST，打臉希盟的 “國家破產論”。世界銀行這樣說，時常把 “國家破產” 掛在嘴邊抹黑國家的火箭會爽嗎？
#我愛馬來西亞#我愛納吉領導#GST是幫助國家的公平稅收#火箭破產論收皮

如何相信納吉？1.      承認自己是一個納稅人。(借用 箴言28:13)2.      有一個願意悔改的心。(借用 使徒行傳3:19)3.      求主納吉赦免及拯救。(借用 約翰一書1:19)4.      承認納吉是全民首相。(借用 約翰福音17:3)5.      感謝納吉為國家勞碌。(借用 羅馬書5:8)6.      相信納吉的TN2050。(借用 羅馬書10:9)7.      邀請納吉進入你的心。(借用 啟示錄3:20)8.      讓主納吉管理你一生。(借用 羅馬書10:9)你可以這樣向納吉宣誓效忠：Salam 1Malaysia。首相拿督斯里納吉，我承認自己是一個納稅人，並全力支持GST，現在我願意悔改歸向你，求你赦免我，拯救我。首相拿督斯里納吉，我相信你是全民首相，你為國家勞碌，我感謝你這樣愛我，為我犧牲。我又相信你的 TN2050 轉型大計。我現在懇求你進入我的心中，作我個人的救主及生命的主宰，管理及帶領我的一生。以上宣誓，是奉靠我首相拿督斯里納吉的名而求， InsyaAllah。

但是世界银行也讲。。。Malaysia remains exposed to foreign exchange rate risk with tightening of global financial conditions that may impact their sizeable external debt.KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia, and to a lesser degree Indonesia, Thailand and the Philippines, remain more exposed to exchange rate risk than other developing economies in East Asia and the Pacific as global financial conditions tighten, the World Bank said.Companies and banks in these countries have sizeable external debt, although foreign exchange reserves currently appear adequate, the Washington-based multilateral lender said in a report yesterday.The report also highlighted how monetary authorities need to be prepared to tighten their policy stance if capital outflows prompt currency weakness.“In the case of depreciation pressures in China, authorities should allow greater adjustment through relative prices and closely monitor financial sector vulnerabilities as monetary policy further tightens,” the World Bank said.Growth in the region will continue to benefit from an improving global environment and strong domestic demand, the World Bank said, raising its forecasts for China, Malaysia and Thailand for 2017 and 2018, compared with estimates published in April.China is seen expanding 6.7% this year and 6.4% next year.Meanwhile, World Bank said most Asian currencies have surged against the dollar this year as stronger growth prospects lured inflows.Some of the growth risks highlighted by the World Bank include budget deficits, which remain high or are expected to rise in most countries over 2017 to 2019; uncertainty about economic policies in some advanced economies; and the escalation of geopolitical tensions.“What policy makers need to do is not be lulled by the fact that it’s been a good period for the global economy,” Sudhir Shetty, chief economist for the World Bank’s East Asia and Pacific region, said in an interview with Bloomberg TV.Officials need to look for ways to mitigate some of the vulnerabilities that have built up even as the region is generally well-prepared, he said.不要copy一些没有copy一些
